In this post, veteran web designer Paul Boag shares his approach to getting things done in even the most challenging organizations.

entry.title: How To Build A Progressively Enhanced, Accessible, Filterable And Paginated List
entry.summary: Ever wondered how to build a paginated list that works with and without JavaScript? In this article, Manuel explains how you can leverage the power of Progressive Enhancement and do just that with Eleventy and Alpine.js.

entry.title: SmashingConf Is Back In 2022
entry.summary: After two years when almost everything moved online, 2022 marks the return of in-person conferences. In fact, [SmashingConf is back](https://smashingconf.com/conferences): coming to San Francisco and Austin in June, Freiburg (Germany) in September, and New York in October.

entry.title: A Guide To Hover And Pointer Media Queries
entry.summary: In this article, we‚Äôll talk about how to adapt our sites to the different scenarios of a device pointer: whether it has a pointer or not, or how accurate it is. entry.title: Those HTML Attributes You Never Use

entry.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties
entry.summary: CSS Custom Properties can be used for far more than just color, and their values update in realtime, both via display mode updates and JavaScript logic. This is powerful stuff. Eric explains how modern CSS is a powerful piece of assistive technology that can thread into it to create flexible, maintainable and adaptive digital experiences.
